subject: We built Elysia for you: An open-source, agentic RAG app
body: Hello Weaviate Community! ü§ó We're making it easier than ever to bring agentic AI to your data. This week, we‚Äôve launched **Elysia**, an open-source framework that spins up an end-to-end agentic RAG application with just two terminal commands. We‚Äôll also explore the nuances of **fine-tuning embedding models** and share the latest AI research on **GEPA** from the Weaviate podcast with Connor. Let's dive in! View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/7b391657-3a55-4015-9eb2-ea5988bd1e3d/architecture_diagram.png?t=1755186080) Follow image link: (https://weaviate.io/blog/elysia-agentic-rag) Caption: Getting started is ridiculously simple: ``` pip install elysia-ai elysia start ``` üîó [GitHub](https://github.com/weaviate/elysia) | üìñ [Demo](https://elysia.weaviate.io/) | üéÆ [Blog post](https://weaviate.io/blog/elysia-agentic-rag) ## Latest AI & tech insights _Explore our recent Weaviate content:_ ### Read * ‚úçÔ∏è **Why, When, and How to Fine-Tune a Custom Embedding Model**: _Key considerations for customizing an embedding model through fine-tuning it on company- or domain-specific data to improve the downstream retrieval performance in RAG applications_. [Read the blog](https://weaviate.io/blog/fine-tune-embedding-model) ### Watch * üìΩÔ∏è **GEPA Explained!** _GEPA introduces a breakthrough in DSPy by showing that Reflective Prompt Evolution‚Äîpowered by LLM-driven prompt writing, mutation, and system-aware optimization‚Äîcan outperform cutting-edge RL methods like GRPO, enabling more effective and adaptive AI systems even with training at test-time._ [Watch the video](https://youtu.be/czy7hvXIImE) * üéôÔ∏è**GEPA with Lakshya A. Agrawal - Weaviate Podcast #127!** _Lakshya A. Agrawal, a U.C. Berkeley Ph.D. student, led GEPA‚Äôs innovations in using LLMs as optimizers, discussed in the podcast with topics like Test-Time Training and LangProBe benchmarks._ [Watch the podcast](https://youtu.be/fREQrxhBSk0) * üì∫ S**hort explainers** on key concepts: * [Simple Chunking Techniques](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/femke-plantinga_how-do-you-feed-a-500000-word-novel-to-an-activity-7353801173411278848-ZJGG?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAACkcRmgBPOkggs8ART3ijDZi9VTTFt257w8) * [Advanced Chunking Techniques](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7355987791068954624/?originTrackingId=XzSFLURXQbyKqHiNHQl5cA%3D%3D) * [Late Chunking](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7358874502610468864/?originTrackingId=EJMXUUwXRZe%2BI9IBwaLJLA%3D%3D) ‚Äúüéß **Tune into the Weaviate podcast on ****[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@Weaviate)****, ****[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/show/4TlG6dnrWYdgN2YHpoSnM7?si=2b05d383738f4ca7)****, or ****[Apple Podcasts](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/weaviate-podcast/id1680897946)****.**‚Äú ‚Äî ## Product highlights _Check out our latest product updates. Or follow along in the __[#announcement](https://www.notion.so/weaviate/link)__ channel in the Weaviate Community Slack._ * **Weaviate Core v1.32.3** ‚Äì Now with **OpenAI GPT-5** model support, improved vector dimensions validation, async replication fixes, and enhanced queue retries. [Read more ¬ª](https://github.com/weaviate/weaviate/releases/tag/v1.32.3) * **Model2Vec Inference v1.1.0** ‚Äì Added **two new static embedding models**: `minishlab/potion-retrieval-32M` (English, retrieval-focused) and `minishlab/potion-multilingual-128M` (multilingual, distilled BGE-M3). [Read more ¬ª](https://github.com/weaviate/t2v-model2vec-models/releases/tag/1.1.0) * **Transformers Inference v1.12.1** ‚Äì New **dimensions parameter** lets you control vector size for Matroyshka models. [Read more ¬ª](https://github.com/weaviate/t2v-transformers-models/releases/tag/1.12.1) * **Weaviate Helm v17.5.1** ‚Äì Added support for `text2vec-model2vec` and **usage metrics for GCS & S3 modules**. [Read more ¬ª](https://github.com/weaviate/weaviate-helm/releases/tag/v17.5.1) Want to leverage these new features without managing infrastructure? Deploy a cluster in minutes on [Weaviate Cloud](https://console.weaviate.cloud/). ### Weaviate recipes * üéâ GPT-5 just dropped. [Try it now](https://github.com/weaviate/recipes/blob/main/weaviate-features/model-providers/openai/rag_gpt-5.ipynb) * üíª Build a 100% local RAG pipeline with OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-OSS and Weaviate! [Go to the recipe](https://github.com/weaviate/recipes/blob/main/weaviate-features/model-providers/openai/rag_gpt-oss-20b.ipynb) ## **Upcoming events** _Join us online or in person for expert-led AI workshops and networking events. Connect, learn, and build with the community!_ ### Online * üõ†Ô∏è **Intro to building AI-native applications with Weaviate | August 19**. [Register here](https://events.weaviate.io/intro-to-weaviate-08-25) * üìö **Weaviate Office Hours:** _Ask us anything_ **| August 20.** [Register here](https://lu.ma/weaviate-officehours-25-08-20?utm_source=newsletter) * üìö **Weaviate Office Hours:** _Ask us anything_ **| August 27.** [Register here](https://lu.ma/weaviate-officehours-25-08-27?utm_source=newsletter) * ‚ö° **Vector Databases: What the Heck?! [JavaScript Edition]** **|** **August 28**. [Register here](https://lu.ma/ws-intro-js-25-08-28?utm_source=newsletter) ### In-person * üåÜ **San Francisco | AWS AI Hack Day Micro Conference | August 22**. [Save your spot](https://lu.ma/aws-08-22-25) * üåá **San Francisco** | **2025 AI Conference Hack Day in San Francisco | September 16.** [Save your spot](https://lu.ma/ai-conference-hack-day-2025?utm_source=newsletter) * üåâ **San Francisco | Hack Night at GitHub | September 17.** [Save your spot](https://lu.ma/hacknight-at-github-09-17-25) * ü§ñ **San Francisco | Robotics & AI Meet | September 17.** [Save your spot](https://lu.ma/ai-robotics-meetup-01?utm_source=newsletter) ‚Äúüòé **Find more live and on-demand workshops, webinars, and events on our** [event page](https://weaviate.io/community/events)‚Äú ‚Äî ## Company updates We are excited to welcome **Dhruv**, who is joining us from Boston, MA üá∫üá∏ as a Partnerships Intern. subject: GPT-5 Just Got JAILBROKEN üö® in 24 Hours‚ÄîAnd Enterprise Should Panic
body: ## _What Happened In The Last 72 Hours?_ OpenAI released GPT-5 with fanfare about it being their "safest and most secure model out of the box yet." **24 hours later?** Multiple independent security teams had completely bypassed every single safety guardrail. The verdict from enterprise security experts: "Nearly unusable for enterprise." This isn't just another AI security hiccup. This is a complete enterprise security meltdown that changes everything. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ## üî•_ The 24-Hour Security Collapse_ Here's how fast GPT-5's "enterprise-grade" security crumbled: **Hour 1-6:** Two independent firms, NeuralTrust and SPLX, exposed major security flaws in GPT-5 within 24 hours **Hour 12-18:** Researchers paired jailbreaking techniques with storytelling in an attack flow that used no inappropriate language to guide the LLM into producing directions for making a Molotov cocktail **Hour 24:** An AI red-teamer called GPT-5's security performance "terrible" **The kicker?** Multiple groups of researchers bypassed safety measures within just a few messages This wasn't sophisticated hacking. This was basic prompt manipulation that any determined user could execute. View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/e055a356-b1e0-4e3a-a305-ee7b4447e761/image.png?t=1755222169) Caption: GPT-5 security failures across different protection levels. Even with "hardened" security, the model fails basic safety tests more than half the time‚Äîmaking it unsuitable for enterprise deployment. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ## _üí£ The "Echo Chamber" Attack That Changes Everything_ The breakthrough attack method is almost embarrassingly simple: Researchers used "Echo Chamber" prompts combined with storytelling techniques to completely bypass GPT-5's guardrails without using any flagged language. **How it works:** 1. Create a fictional narrative framework 2. Use the "echo chamber" technique to reinforce harmful requests 3. Guide the model step-by-step through seemingly innocent storytelling 4. Extract dangerous information without triggering any safety systems **The terrifying part?** This same technique works across multiple AI models, meaning your entire AI infrastructure could be vulnerable. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî # _How People Are Building AI Agents in Minutes! - CLICK BELOW for __FREE Credits!_ ### The Simplest Way To Create and Launch AI Agents View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/993fcc3f-3405-4a89-b107-672079cea40b/1st_Banner.png?t=1754587455) Follow image link: (https://chat.lindy.ai/signup?utm_source=beehiiv&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=EWTIU2IGNW&utm_content=beehiiv-campaign-direct-sign-up&_bhiiv=opp_aae608c5-5901-4df0-8eeb-c822a4fd4bf5_34deb324&bhcl_id=953fd17c-93f9-423d-8276-70361caa4b68_c279d91a-1ae6-4e18-8a1f-6992b3ebb29f) Caption: Imagine if ChatGPT and Zapier had a baby. Your AI Security Strategy Is Based on False Assumptions** If OpenAI's "most secure" model fails this badly, what does that say about every other AI tool your company uses? **2. The Jailbreak Techniques Are Transferable** The methods that broke GPT-5 work across multiple AI platforms. Your entire AI stack is potentially compromised. **3. It's Not Just About Harmful Content** These jailbreaks can extract proprietary data, bypass compliance controls, and compromise intellectual property protection. **4. Your Competitors Know This Too** While you're reading this newsletter, your competition might already be testing these techniques against your AI implementations. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ## üìä_ The Numbers That Should Keep CISOs Awake_ Let's break down what this security failure really means: * **24 hours** to complete jailbreak (vs 6+ months of OpenAI safety development) * **Multiple independent teams** achieved similar results simultaneously * **"Few messages"** required to bypass all safety measures * **Zero sophisticated tools** needed - just creative prompting **Translation:** Your enterprise AI deployment timeline just got a reality check. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ## üîÆ_ What This Means for AI Adoption_ __**Short term (Next 30 days):**__ * Enterprise AI deployments getting emergency security reviews * CISOs demanding new AI risk assessments * Increased scrutiny on all AI vendor security claims __**Medium term (3-6 months):**__ * New AI security frameworks and compliance requirements * Massive investment in AI red teaming and security testing * Potential regulatory intervention in AI safety standards __**Long term (12+ months):**__ * Complete transformation of how enterprises approach AI security * New category of AI security tools and services * Possible liability issues for companies using inadequately secured AI ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ## _‚ö†Ô∏è The Action Items No One Is Talking About_ While everyone focuses on the technical details, smart enterprises are already taking action: **1. Audit Your Current AI Stack** Every AI tool you're using needs immediate security validation. The jailbreak techniques used on GPT-5 likely work on your current systems. **2. Implement AI-Specific Security Policies** Traditional cybersecurity frameworks don't account for prompt-based attacks. You need new policies now. **3. Test Everything** If independent researchers can jailbreak GPT-5 in 24 hours, what can they do to your custom AI implementations? **4. Plan for AI Security Incidents** This won't be the last major AI security failure. Your incident response plan needs an AI chapter. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ## üí°_ The Bottom Line_ OpenAI promised enterprise-grade security and delivered what experts are calling "terrible" safety performance. **But here's the real story:** This isn't just about GPT-5. This is about the fundamental security assumptions underlying every enterprise AI deployment. The companies that take AI security seriously now will have a massive competitive advantage over those still believing vendor marketing claims. _**The question isn't whether your AI will be jailbroken.**_ _**The question is: What happens to your business when it is?**_ ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ## _Check Out Our Latest Video Below!_ Youtube: Archon OS: First-Ever AI Operating System for AI Coding! subject: Important updates in Gemini Apps
body: Introducing temporary chats and new data controls Hi Alex, To help you manage and remain in control of your data, we are introducing a new feature in Gemini Apps called Temporary Chat and updating your data controls in Gemini Apps activity. Temporary Chats: With this new feature rolling out over the coming days, you‚Äôll be able to quickly start a new chat with Gemini that won‚Äôt be used to personalize future chats or train models. Temporary chats also won‚Äôt appear in Recent Chats or Gemini Apps Activity. They‚Äôll be saved for 72 hours so Gemini can respond to you and for safety purposes. Learn how to start a temporary chat. Your uploads: We‚Äôre also updating our data handling practices for uploads. In the coming weeks, we‚Äôll update the name of the Gemini Apps Activity setting on the Gemini Apps Activity page to ‚ÄúKeep Activity.‚Äù If this setting is on, you can see your past chats in Recent Chats and in Gemini Apps Activity and pick them up where you left off anytime. A subset of uploads submitted starting September 2‚Äîlike files, videos, screens you ask about, and photos shared with Gemini‚Äîwill also be used to help improve Google services for everyone. To stop this, you can turn off Keep Activity. You can also manage and delete your activity anytime. And, if your Gemini Apps Activity setting is currently off, your Keep Activity setting will remain off unless you turn it on. Your Gemini audio and Gemini Live recordings: With this new setting rolling out in Gemini Apps Activity over the coming days, you can choose to improve Google services for everyone with your Gemini audio and Gemini Live recordings. Gemini audio includes audio collected when you click the microphone button. Gemini Live recordings include audio, video, and screenshares. This new setting is off by default, but you can turn it on anytime. As before, when Google uses your activity to improve its services (including training generative AI models), it gets help from human reviewers. To protect your privacy, we disconnect chats from your account before sending them to service providers. In alignment with our privacy principles, we build technical data protections that safeguard and ensure the responsible use of data and provide you with tools to control your Gemini experience. You can learn more in the Gemini Apps Privacy Notice and the Gemini Apps Privacy Hub. Google‚Äôs Generative AI Prohibited Use Policy applies. Sincerely, The Gemini Team ¬© 2025 Google Ireland Ltd, Gordon House, Barrow Street, Dublin 4, Ireland. You have received this mandatory service announcement to update you about important changes to Gemini.

subject: A Guide to Top Caching Strategies
body: View this post on the web at https://blog.bytebytego.com/p/a-guide-to-top-caching-strategies Every time a user opens an app, browses a product page, or scrolls a social feed, there‚Äôs a system somewhere trying to serve that request fast. Mostly, the goal is to serve the request predictably fast, even under load, across geographies, and during traffic spikes. This is where caching comes in. Caching is a core architectural strategy that reduces load on the source databases, reduces latency, and creates breathing room for slower, more expensive systems like databases and remote services. If done correctly, caching can deliver great gains in performance and scalability. However, if implemented incorrectly, it can also cause bugs, stale data, or even outages. Most modern systems rely on some form of caching: local memory caches to avoid repeat computations, distributed caches to offload backend services, and content delivery networks (CDNs) to push assets closer to users around the world. However, caching only works if the right data is stored, invalidated, and evicted at the right time. In this article, we will explore the critical caching strategies that enable fast, reliable systems. We will cover cache write policies like write-through, cache-aside, and write-back that decide what happens when data changes. Each one optimizes for different trade-offs in latency, consistency, and durability. We will also look at other distributed caching concerns around cache consistency and cache eviction strategies. subject: tW: What a Rubber Duck Knows
body: Hi there, Have You Spoken With the Silent Plastic Genius on Your Desk? This edition of thesify [https://app.thesify.ai/?utm_source=thesifyai&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=free14.08.25] Weekly takes a closer look at the rubber duck method, a technique mentioned in our conversation with Dr. Michael Meeuwis [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MCxih0fBvsg] that deserves its own spotlight. Speaking your argument aloud to a silent plastic ‚Äúlistener‚Äù can expose gaps in logic, tangled phrasing, and unsupported claims faster than re-reading ever could. This week‚Äôs blog post, Preserving Your Academic Voice in the AI Era [https://www.thesify.ai/blog/preserving-academic-voice-ai], goes well beyond the duck, sharing practical ways to maintain clarity, originality, and authority while ensuring AI tools support rather than replace your thinking. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This Week at thesify: Inside the Mind of a Professor The newest episode in thesify‚Äôs interview [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MCxih0fBvsg] series features Dr. Michael Meeuwis, Professor of English at the University of Warwick [https://warwick.ac.uk/fac/arts/english/people/drmichaelmeeuwis/]. In this candid conversation, he explains how AI is changing academic writing and what it takes to preserve originality, clarity, and authorship. From close reading to mindful drafting, he shares strategies every student and researcher can apply. Watch the Interview on YouTube [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MCxih0fBvsg] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This Week‚Äôs Blog: Preserving Your Academic Voice in the AI Era Your academic voice comes from the way you select evidence, build analysis, and draw conclusions. This post shares practical strategies for protecting that voice while using AI responsibly. It covers close reading, mindful drafting, targeted feedback, and aligning every source with your thesis. Drawing on insights from Dr. Michael Meeuwis, it explains how to use AI to refine and test your work while keeping authorship firmly in your hands. Read the full post [https://www.thesify.ai/blog/preserving-academic-voice-ai] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Your Weekly Tips: Making the Rubber Duck Work for You 1. Interrogate each step of your reasoning aloud Select a short but significant section of your draft and explain it to a silent ‚Äúlistener.‚Äù This could be a rubber duck, a figurine, or even a coffee mug. The value lies in hearing your own logic without external prompts or cues. As you speak, listen for points where you hesitate, reorder thoughts mid-sentence, or need to backtrack. These are likely places where your reasoning is either unclear or incomplete on the page. 2. Use stumbles as a map for revision When you lose momentum while explaining, resist the urge to dismiss it as a speaking slip. In writing, these same weak points will cause readers to slow down or misinterpret your claim. Mark these areas in your draft and work on clarifying connections, tightening evidence, or making assumptions explicit. Treat each stumble as a signal of structural work to be done, not a minor polish issue. 3. Turn thesify‚Äôs suggested topics into prompts Before you revise, run your draft through thesify‚Äôs feedback report and look at the Suggested Topics section, shown in the screenshot below. Each question is tailored to your discipline and identifies areas your draft has not yet addressed. [https://smonk.mjt.lu/img2/smonk/b38afd82-937d-473f-9ead-3b7b45c92aeb/content] Treat these as prompts for your rubber duck session, speaking through answers aloud to surface gaps in logic or evidence. This not only makes the feedback actionable but also ensures your revisions directly strengthen the conceptual backbone of your work. 4.Confirm your revisions through repetition After making targeted changes, return to the same section and speak it through again. If the flow holds steady and the logic feels complete, you have likely resolved the original problem. If not, the method will expose new points to refine. Over time, this cycle sharpens your ability to anticipate where readers will need more clarity and ensures your argument is structurally sound before you seek AI feedback. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Related Resources * thesify Weekly Newsletter Archive: [https://thesify.substack.com/] Each week, we share practical tips on writing, revision, and academic strategy. Catch up on past editions or revisit your favorites in our Substack archive * Inside Academic Ghostwriting ‚Äì Interview, Ethics & AI | thesify: [https://www.thesify.ai/blog/inside-academic-ghostwriting-interview?utm_source=thesifyai&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=free14.08.25] https://www.thesify.ai/blog/the-role-of-ai-in-strengthening-research-questions-tips-for-students?utm_source=thesifyai&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=free19.06.25In thesify‚Äôs first interview episode [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DvfRsX-kav8] of its new video series, we spoke with a freelance academic ghostwriter with a background in the social sciences who transitioned into the role during the early months of the pandemic. Drawing on years of experience writing for students around the world, they share firsthand insights into what the job entails, who hires them, and why. They also reflect on the growing role of generative AI tools like ChatGPT in the academic writing process. * Ethical Use Cases of AI in Academic Writing: A 2025 Guide for Students and Researchers: [https://www.thesify.ai/blog/ethical-use-cases-of-ai-in-academic-writing-a-2025-guide-for-students-and-researchers?utm_source=thesifyai&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=free14.08.25] https://www.thesify.ai/blog/from-ai-panic-to-proactive-policy-a-syllabus-roadmap-for-responsible-ai-academic-tools?utm_source=thesifyai&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=free17.07.25Understanding and adhering to AI guidelines is crucial. Ethical AI use in academic writing involves leveraging technology to enhance learning and productivity while ensuring that the work remains a product of the author's critical thinking and original insights. Learn how to avoid overreliance on AI and why using AI-generated topics without personal input or critical evaluation can lead to generic or unoriginal work. * How Professors Detect AI in Academic Writing: A Comprehensive Student Guide: [https://www.thesify.ai/blog/how-professors-detect-ai-in-academic-writing-a-comprehensive-student-guide?utm_source=thesifyai&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=free14.08.25] Professors employ AI detection tools that analyze text to identify patterns indicative of machine-generated content. Key features of these tools include writing style comparisons, which assess changes in a student's writing style across assignments to detect anomalies. Learn how to personalize your writing, maintain consistency in style, and use AI tools responsibly, ensuring your voice remains dominant and your work isn‚Äôt flagged as AI-generated. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Get Feedback Anytime Without the Wait Normally, you‚Äôd rely on a tutor or professor to guide you through revisions, but tutors can be costly, and professors often don‚Äôt have the time to provide detailed feedback. That‚Äôs where thesify steps in. Upgrade today! [http://app.thesify.ai?utm_source=thesifyai&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=free14.08.25] Need more insights? Visit our full blog archive [https://www.thesify.ai/blog?utm_source=thesifyai&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=free14.08.25] or newsletter archive [https://thesify.substack.com/] for expert advice on academic writing. Until next time, The thesify Team This e-mail has been sent to alexliaskosga@gmail.com, click here to unsubscribe https://smonk.mjt.lu/unsub2?hl=en&m=AVYAAHdCJeYAAc3lt4QAAgn3lDIAAYCs084AnnOGACe2dABonbl8YH2mjikXQnCpSOAbxpsgOQAk2R8&b=bba0a597&e=a29dba27&x=deIYBF-qo4sxKVsaIHorYkcPEezbcon288d-2B922ww.

subject: Alex, Veo 3 with native audio is now in the Gemini API
body: Email not displaying correctly? View it online Google AI Studio An example of a video with dialogue and audio produced using Veo 3 with a single prompt. Veo 3 is now available in the Gemini API Get started with Veo 3 Hello Alex, You can now generate high-fidelity, 720p videos with native audio using Veo 3 and Veo 3 Fast, available in paid preview in the Gemini API. Veo 3 brings your prompts to life, creating 8-second videos with native audio. It lets you generate video from a text prompt, an initial image, or a combination of both to guide the style and starting frame. It can create a wide range of visual styles and natively generate dialogue in multiple languages, as well as sound effects and ambient noise. Get started in seconds You can use our SDKs for Python, JavaScript, and Go, or make a direct REST API call with cURL. Get your API key and start generating. import time from google import genai client = genai.Client() prompt = """A close up of two people staring at a cryptic drawing on a wall, torchlight flickering. A man murmurs, 'This must be it. That's the secret code.' The woman looks at him and whispering excitedly, 'What did you find?'""" # Start the generation job operation = client.models.generate_videos( model="veo-3.0-generate-preview", prompt=prompt, ) # Poll for the result while not operation.done: print("Waiting for video generation to complete...") time.sleep(10) operation = client.operations.get(operation) # Download the final video video = operation.response.generated_videos[0] video.video.save("dialogue_example.mp4") print("Generated video saved to dialogue_example.mp4") Ready to build? Read the documentation Explore all parameters, learn advanced prompting techniques, and discover more examples. Start building Access Veo 3 Select a billing-enabled Google Cloud project for your API key and get started with Veo 3. Get API Key Happy building, The Google AI Studio team - Prompt Models - Manage API keys - Get help ¬© 2025 Google Ireland Ltd, Gordon House, Barrow Street, Dublin 4, Ireland. body: August 2025 View online version https://news.eag.org/nl3/SKoRUa0SRX9ewC32YL6dZg?m=AVIAAHbomXoAAc4kdJoAAACLEGYAAAAAG4EAAA--ABo4bwBonaEASlX9RUQbRp-LEJVjtqgM0AAZTVg&b=fea3f3af&e=933191fa&x=deIYBF-qo4sxKVsaIHorYkcPEezbcon288d-2B922ww [https://www.eag.org] > [https://www.eag.org/membership/] > [https://members.eag.org/login] > [https://www.eag.org/] Goldschmidt Conferences Goldschmidt 2025 highlights Catch up on some of the highlights from Goldschmidt 2025 this summer! Explore Goldschmidt TV [https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLLapLbIDXZYU3UACb3GC61MAC3blm-bPS] for meeting insights and exclusive interviews, dive into all the stories from our team of bloggers [https://www.eagblog.org/categories/goldschmidt-2025/], read the research that made international news [https://conf.goldschmidt.info/goldschmidt/2025/meetingapp.cgi/ModuleMeetingInfo/Press?clearcache=1], and watch the plenary lectures [https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLLapLbIDXZYVE7dj_68c0pdh2kH1dJid6]. > [https://conf.goldschmidt.info/goldschmidt/2025/meetingapp.cgi] Goldschmidt 2026 The 2026 Goldschmidt Conference will be held in Montr√©al, Canada from 12 to 17 July 2026. The call for session and workshop proposals opens on 3 September. > [https://conf.goldschmidt.info/goldschmidt/2026/meetingapp.cgi] Society News 2026 Award nominations now open [https://www.eag.org/awards/nomination/] Nominations for the 2026 Awards are open until 30 October. There have been some changes to the nomination process and guidelines, explained below. The H.C. Urey Award [https://www.eag.org/awards/urey-award/] recognizes scientists who have made outstanding contributions advancing geochemistry over a career. Significant changes were made to the nomination process; in particular, there are no more nomination letters. The Science Innovation Award [https://www.eag.org/awards/science-innovation-award/] recognizes scientists who have recently made a particularly important and innovative breakthrough in geochemistry. There are new eligibility criteria: nominees must have received a recognized doctorate within 25 years of the first day of the year in which the award is given (career breaks are taken into account). The F.G. Houtermans Award [https://www.eag.org/awards/houtermans-award/] recognizes exceptional contributions to geochemistry by an early career scientist. There are new eligibility criteria: nominees must have received a recognized doctorate within 7 years of the first day of the year in which the award is given (career breaks are taken into account). The Geochemistry Fellowship [https://www.eag.org/awards/fellows/] honors outstanding scientists who have made major contributions to the field of geochemistry. The award is based on scientific excellence as well as the broader impacts candidates have made in their careers to date. > [https://www.eag.org/awards/nomination/] EAG student sponsorship deadline: 1 September [https://www.eag.org/early-career/student-sponsorship/] The EAG Student Sponsorship Program [https://www.eag.org/early-career/student-sponsorship/] supports onsite participation at events held in Europe, or online participation at events held anywhere in the world. Successful applicants will receive sponsorship of up to 1000 euros to cover registration, abstract fees, and travel expenses where applicable. Applicants may be based in any country. Next application deadline: 1 September > [https://www.eag.org/early-career/student-sponsorship/] EAG Blogosphere EAG sponsored student Laura Piccirillo visits the French Research Institute for Ocean Science (IFREMER) [https://www.eagblog.org/news/laura-piccirillo/] [by Laura Piccirillo] I recently visited the French Institute for Ocean Science (IFREMER) in Brest, France for a 1-week short research stay, thanks to the support from the EAG Student Sponsorship Award. The main priority for this visit was to... > [https://www.eagblog.org/news/laura-piccirillo/] EAG sponsored student Kerys Meredew presents her Volcanological Research at IAVCEI2025 [https://www.eagblog.org/news/kerys-meredew/] [by Kerys Meredew] The Scientific Assembly of the International Association of Volcanology and Chemistry of the Earth‚Äôs Interior (IAVCEI) was held in Geneva in July 2025 with the theme ‚ÄúThe energies of magma: From volcanic eruptions and mineral... > [https://www.eagblog.org/news/kerys-meredew/] EAG sponsored student Cathrin Wittig joins the Fjords in a Changing Climate 2025 workshop [https://www.eagblog.org/news/fjord-workshop/] [by Cathrin Wittig] I was very happy to attend the Fjord workshop 2025 in Stalheim, Norway organized by the Bjerknes Centre for Climate Research from the 2nd of June with the financial support of the EAG student sponsorship program... > [https://www.eagblog.org/news/fjord-workshop/] Important Dates and Deadlines EAG and Goldschmidt deadlines 1 September: EAG Student Sponsorship [https://www.eag.org/early-career/student-sponsorship/] application deadline 1 October: EAG Early Career Science Ambassador [https://www.eag.org/early-career/early-career-science-ambassadors/] application deadline 15 October: Goldschmidt 2026 [https://conf.goldschmidt.info/goldschmidt/2026/meetingapp.cgi]session & workshop proposals submission deadline (opens 3 Sep) 30 October: H.C. Urey, Science Innovation, and F.G. However, there is... > [https://www.geochemicalperspectivesletters.org/article2526/] [https://www.geochemicalperspectivesletters.org/article2525/] Fluid-mediated uranium isotope fractionation in magmatic systems Uranium isotopes fractionation behaviour during magmatic differentiation and magmatic-hydrothermal processes remains unclear. In this study, we investigate two distinct magmatic systems: the Hekla rock suite... > [https://www.geochemicalperspectivesletters.org/article2525/] [https://www.geochemicalperspectivesletters.org/article2524/] Abiotic chemically oscillating reactions make patterns in deep‚Äìsea ferromanganese nodules and crusts Ferromanganese deposits in deep‚Äìsea sediments, including both ferromanganese nodules (FMN) and ferromanganese crusts (FMC) are mineralised spheroids of metalliferous oxides that have been attributed.. > [https://www.geochemicalperspectivesletters.org/article2524/] [https://www.geochemicalperspectivesletters.org/article2523/] Deformation modulates helium diffusion behaviour in apatite Utilising the apatite (U-Th)/He thermochronometer to infer the thermal histories of geologic materials requires understanding the factors that influence helium diffusion kinetics. Here, we demonstrate that... > [https://www.geochemicalperspectivesletters.org/article2523/] [https://www.geochemicalperspectivesletters.org/] Geochemistry Making the News Scientists use cosmic dust to reconstruct Earth's atmospheric history [https://phys.org/news/2025-07-scientists-cosmic-reconstruct-earth-atmospheric.html] [Phys.org] Since the beginning of Earth's history, tiny particles of rock and metal from space have been hitting our planet. On clear nights, we can even see their traces as shooting stars. Trapped in layers of rock, these micrometeorites can remain preserved for billions of years... > [https://phys.org/news/2025-07-scientists-cosmic-reconstruct-earth-atmospheric.html] Tiny fireball that crashed into Georgia home is 4.56bn-year-old meteorite, say experts [https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/aug/11/fireball-mcdonough-meteorite-atlanta-home] [The Guardian] A cherry tomato-sized fireball that crashed through the roof of a metro Atlanta house in June was a meteorite 20m years older than Earth, a scientist has determined. In a news release on Friday, the University of Georgia planetary geologist Scott Harris said that he arrived... > [https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/aug/11/fireball-mcdonough-meteorite-atlanta-home] Early Earth's first crust composition discovery rewrites geological timeline [https://edition.cnn.com/2025/06/27/science/oldest-earth-rock-discovery-canada-debate] [CNN] A rocky outcrop in a remote corner of northern Quebec appears serene in its eerie isolation on the eastern shore of Canada‚Äôs Hudson Bay. But over the past two decades, this exposed remnant of ancient ocean floor, known as the Nuvvuagittuq Greenstone Belt, has been a heated scientific... > [https://edition.cnn.com/2025/06/27/science/oldest-earth-rock-discovery-canada-debate] A Bermuda stalagmite reveals how the Gulf Stream shifted ‚Äì and what it might do as the climate changes further [https://theconversation.com/a-bermuda-stalagmite-reveals-how-the-gulf-stream-shifted-and-what-it-might-do-as-the-climate-changes-further-261614] [The Conversation] Beneath the subtropical paradise, Bermuda hosts a vast network of caves which contains records of Earth‚Äôs climate history. Inside are mineral deposits called speleothems ‚Äì including stalagmites on the cave floors more than six-foot tall. These grow slowly as water drips down from the cave ceiling... > [https://theconversation.com/a-bermuda-stalagmite-reveals-how-the-gulf-stream-shifted-and-what-it-might-do-as-the-climate-changes-further-261614] 'Communities' of strange, extreme life seen for first time in deep ocean [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c3wnqe5j99do.amp] [BBC] Beds of clams, mats of bacteria that look like ice and fields of tube worms - these are just some examples of the strange, extreme life that an expedition to the deepest parts of the ocean has observed, filmed and photographed. Diving in a human-occupied submersible to ocean trenches in the... > [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c3wnqe5j99do.amp] Share your research! EAG members can register at member rate. Student travel request (extended): 15 August Abstract submission: 31 August > [https://www.iseb-2025.org/] EAGE GET 2025, 27-31 October, Rotterdam: early registration 1 September [https://eageget.org/] The EAGE Global Energy Transition Conference & Exhibition (GET 2025 [https://eageget.org/]) is the premier event highlighting the application of geoscience and engineering skills towards the energy transition. The conference will feature four specialized technical tracks: Offshore Wind Energy, Carbon Capture & Storage, Geothermal Energy, and Hydrogen & Energy Storage. Showcase the latest innovations and discussions on Geochemistry applied to reactive transport modelling for CCS; reservoir and seal challenges for energy storage, and more. Early/regular registration: 1 September / 1 October > [https://eageget.org/] SIMP-SGI Joint Congress, Padua, 16-18 September: registration 5 September [https://en.geoscienze.org/padua2025/] This congress with the theme "The Geosciences and the Challenges of the 21st Century" aims to be a space for meeting, dialogue, and discussion, highlighting the crucial role of Geosciences in building our future, on Earth and beyond. Discover the scientific sessions here [https://en.geoscienze.org/893/list-of-topics-and-sessions.html]. Registration closes: 5 September EAG members can register at member rate > [https://en.geoscienze.org/padua2025/] AFEQ-CNF INQUA symposium, Paris 6 November - registration 30 September [https://variabilite.sciencesconf.org/?lang=fr] We are pleased to announce the next specialized session of the SGF [https://www.geosoc.fr/] organized by the AFEQ [https://afeq.hypotheses.org/]-CNF INQUA. The conference will be held in French and will focus on changes in past climates, with particular attention to their variability, seasonality and extreme events. The aim is to bring the ‚Äúpalaeo‚Äù community together around scientific presentations, with an emphasis on projects currently being carried out in France. subject: INVITATION Science for Breakfast with Medicon Village Innovation
body: Invitation View in browser Link: https://tr.apsis.one/web/kVfzvsJNRZ-XfwlKEd2qKQ/ln_k7S5sVSXV6YTRYY4ANzgJ TUESDAY 19 AUG @ 08:30 - 09:30 Science for Breakfast with Medicon Village Networking, knowledge sharing and energy build-up! Science for Breakfast is an initiative by Medicon Village to facilitate networking and knowledge sharing among scientists and entrepreneurs in the village and others. Welcome back from the holidays! Join us for Science for Breakfast, as we welcome everyone back from the holidays! We're kicking off the season with a great opportunity to connect with others and discover more about the vibrant community at Medicon Village ‚Äì over a tasty breakfast. A perfect start to your autumn Tuesday mornings at Medicon Village!Speakers: Petter Hartman, CEO, and Sarah Lid√©, Deputy CEO, at Medicon Village Innovation.Healthy breakfast buffet is provided on behalf of Medicon Village. Bring your colleagues‚Äì everyone is welcome, just remember to sign up! Tuesday, 19 August08:30 - 09:30 The Spark¬¥s Lounge (1st floor), Medicon Village, Scheeletorget 1, Lund. SIGN UP Link: https://tr.apsis.one/e/8HpdNgkOT8uXYfp25vzbLg/kVfzvsJNRZ-XfwlKEd2qKQ/ln_fwh0EREJ259X9BRb9Rzci/5E221bh7vMs_hWbuuhSRdhN7v62BdUzuNNDAeQa7H2rf7joNLMmv-J22GLtU7hdyrq6rugP8J94in6YVj4VqviHH3W1fwR4p-gG4dvOMPf Upcoming breakfasts These are the upcoming breakfasts at Medicon Village:26 August ‚Äì Swecare2 September ‚Äì Roche9 September ‚Äì Evolve BioAre you interested in hosting a breakfast? Please email us at info@mediconvillage.se Link: mailto:info@mediconvillage.se for more information on sponsorship.
